channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London Perl and Raku Workshop
item.description: October 26, 2024, in London, UK

item.title: Purdue Perl Mongers
item.description: October 9, 2024, Virtual event

item.title: Boston.pm monthly meeting
item.description: October 8, 2024, Virtual event

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Great CPAN modules released last week.

item.title: Week 288 - Closest Palindrome & Contiguous Block
item.description: Walkthrough of complex algorithm made so simple. Great work, keep it up.

item.title: Block the Palindrome
item.description: Interesting use of FIFO queue and implementation in Raku discussed line by line, very handy to decode. Highly recommended.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #288
item.description: Breaking down complex algorithm into smaller steps lead to a readable and easy to follow solution. Great work, thanks for sharing.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 288
item.description: Clean and simple solution that is self explanatory. Well done.

item.title: Nearness and contiguity
item.description: It is always pleasure to see how the task contributor deals with his own challenge. I must say, you will love it. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: A Man, A Plan, A Canal… PANAMA!
item.description: One stop for multiple programming languages. With that we get the special of each. Keep it up great work.

item.title: The Simple and the Fast
item.description: Two different approaches, simple and fast. You pick your favourites. Great work.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 288
item.description: Regex? I am pleasantly surprised to see the use of regex to get the Palindrome task done. You really don't want to skip. Thanks for your contribution.

item.title: not complete!
item.description: A very simple yet effective approach and easy to follow using Raku. Thanks for sharing knowledge with us.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 288: Closest Palindrome
item.description: Cool trick to get the job done alongwith Raku magic. Bonus, as always, we got Perl implementation too. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Contiguous Palindromes
item.description: Mathematical approach to deal with Palindrome, something I never seen before. Great work, thanks for sharing.

item.title: Return of the Son of This Looks Like A Job For Recursion!
item.description: Welcome back with yet another thoroughly discussed solution. Hope to see more in coming weeks.

item.title: Contiguously Closest
item.description: As always we got plenty of Raku magics, specially the debug mode. Highly recommended.

item.title: Diving Deep: Recursive Solutions for Palindromes and Contiguous Blocks
item.description: Clever use of recursive approach in Perl and Go. Hope to see regular post from next week onward.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 288
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Closest Palindrome" and "Contiguous Block" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 289
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Third Maximum" and "Jumbled Letters". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Cloud VM performance / price comparison 2024
item.description: Talk on the topic was presented at The Perl and Raku Conference 2024.

item.title: This week in PSC (161) | 2024-09-27
item.description: Interesting topics discussed in the last team meetup. Thank you PSC for your time and effort.

item.title: Board Reflections: Continued Experiences with The Perl Foundation
item.description: Part two and last post continued to talk about various projects handled by Makoto.

item.title: Things I've Learned Serving on the Board of The Perl Foundation
item.description: Part one of 2-parts series post, Makoto-san shares his experience @ TPF.

item.title: Crypt::OpenSSL::PKCS12 1.93 released to CPAN
item.description: The release is offering a new feature: info which can provide the user with information from the OpenSSL object being worked on.

item.title: Perl-Conf.Ru
item.description: If you missed the event then you can still checkout the event results.

item.title: #688 - Perl and Hacktoberfest
item.description:
Hi there,

A belated happy birthday to Larry Wall, who turned 70 last Friday, 27th September.

Opensource contributions season is about to start with Hacktoberfest tomorrow. It would continue the whole month, enough time for you to contribute to opensource projects. Although I have registered to be part of this year event but I doubt to have time for contribution unfortunately.

For me, I am looking forward to the most awaited event, London Perl & Raku Workshop 2024. It is happening after a long gap of 5 years. If you are planning to attend the event then I would suggest you register your details as it would help the organiser to manage the event smoothly.

There is another Perl Conference that I completely missed and it was Perl-Conf.Ru. The first Perl developers conference in Russia in four years.

Enjoy rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
